serviceProviders.name: Barnabus
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Our Beacon drop-in is open 5 days a week offering a hot breakfast, snacks and some evening meals. We also offer food, clothes, blankets, hot showers and toiletries for our friends. The centre receives around 500 visits per week where our friends are able to take part in a range of activities. We run a variety of classes at our drop-in to help build self esteem, confidence and skills. We also offer opportunities for training and volunteering as part of our buddy scheme. We also have a part time nurse funded by the Big Lottery. 3 days a week in a our drop-in, she provides basic nursing, registration with a GP and referrals to specialist clinics. We also hold afternoon activity sessions at the drop in Tuesday-Thursday. The Beacon is often the start of our friends' journey. We then refer them onto our support workers at our separate support office who offer one to one support 5 days a week.
serviceProviders.locationDescription: The Beacon, drop in centre on Bloom Street near Chorlton Street Bus Station

serviceProviders.name: Samaritans
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: If there's something troubling you, come to us for confidential advice.

serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Drop in advice hub open daily providing support and advice, free internet access, free drinks and a snack.

serviceProviders.name: Cornerstone
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: A warm, safe and comfortable environment to access our services, rest or meet other clients and socialise.

serviceProviders.name: Salford Loaves and Fishes
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Drop-in centre offering a communal space with an equipped lounge. Cheap hot meals, showers and laundry. Free tea, coffee and soup. The centre hosts services provided by the Citizens Advice Bureau and Salford Health Matters - support and advice, doctor's surgery, drug and alcohol clinic, needle exchange, dental treatment. Specialist stop smoking advice and literacy support.

serviceProviders.name: Justlife
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Drop in for a coffee and chat or to use the computer.

serviceProviders.name: Urban Village Medical Practice
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Homeless Clinic dropin for registered patients - to register contact Rachel Brennan on 07847476402 or 0161 2725652. We have GP and nurse, drug assessment/treatment, alcohol and mental health advice.

serviceProviders.name: St Ann's Hospice
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: The health and wellbeing Hub is a drop in service, anybody is welcome - patients carers and health care professionals - to get information and advice and to see what we can offer. A registered nurse will be available throughout the session. A volunteer will also be available to help people access online information and creative therapy materials will be available as well. We are hoping that this new service will mean we can provide help and advice to more people and that more patients for the potentially progressive life-limiting illness will be able to access our services.
serviceProviders.locationDescription:
NB: The service is available for three weeks of the month at the address below: 

St Ann’s Hospice 
Meadowsweet Lane (off Peel Lane)
Little Hulton, Worsley,
Manchester M28 OFE

The remaining week will be an outreach service. It is advisable to confirm location details with the organisation on  0161 702 5416.

serviceProviders.name: St Ann's Church
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Morning Hours is a safe-space for anyone who is street homeless and moved out of shop doorways in the early hours. In addition to providing a safe-space, Morning Hours has toilet facilities, as well as a basic breakfast of tea/coffee and toast. Morning Hours is open every Friday, between 7am and 9am.

serviceProviders.name: Stockport Loaves and Fishes
serviceProviders.serviceInfo: Drop in providing a hot meal and drinks, a warm and friendly environment where you can get tents, sleeping bags, clothing and toiletries and advice and guidance. You also get a carry out bag of food after you have been fed.

synopsis: Day centres and social spaces that support homeless people.
